title: Proletarian Line
text:
Proletarian Line () was a <a href="communism">communist</a> group in <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>. It emerged from the Carlos Alberto Morales Regional Committee (based in the <a href="coffee">coffee</a> districts) of the <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20Colombia%20%28Marxist-Leninist%29">Communist Party of Colombia (Marxist-Leninist)</a> (PCC(ML)), which had broken away from the mother party in 1976. The leader of the group was Julio Bedoya. Linea Proletaria strived for the build-up of an 'independent political labour movement', and less focus on armed struggle than PCC(ML).
In 1982 the group merged into the <a href="Revolutionary%20Unification%20Movement%20-%20Marxist-Leninist">Revolutionary Unification Movement - Marxist-Leninist</a>.
